subject: Art & Design
title: The Zeigarnik Effect: Incomplete Tasks Haunt You
description: A fast breakdown of The Zeigarnik Effect: Incomplete Tasks Haunt You for builders.

hook.text: LinkedIn says your profile is 72% complete. That missing 28% nags at you. You keep coming back to finish it.

buildup.text: The Zeigarnik Effect: incomplete tasks are remembered better than completed ones. The brain keeps them 'open.'

discovery.text: Progress bars, step counters, and completion percentages exploit this: showing progress creates a compulsion to finish.

twist.text: Cliffhangers in TV shows use the same principle. The incomplete story pulls you to the next episode.

climax.text: Onboarding checklists (3 of 5 steps done!) use Zeigarnik to drive activation. Users hate leaving tasks undone.

punchline.text: Want someone to finish? Show them how close they already are.
